page.title: 03Brainshaugh Priory.
page.content: The ruins of Brainshaugh Priory lie within a loop of the River Coquet at Guyzance.The chapel dates from the twelfth century and was built by Richard Tison for the benefit of a group of nuns from a religious community in Alnwick.The chapel and other buildings would have been small and served the basic needs of the community.The nuns farmed the land in the area and had grazing rights in various other parishes. The chapel fell into disuse during the 18th.century, although weddings continued to be performed for many years and burials took place until the 19th.century.Today the chapel grounds are used as the private burial ground for the Milburn family of Brainshaugh and Guyzance, the most recent being that of Sir J.N.Milburn Bt.July 1985.
